column4: what is the maximum/average transfer rate between 2 computers conected through an ethernet cable?
depends on the specifications of the network cards

not much. If you need to write to it, make sure to use NTFS-3g. Oh, and if you don't shut down Windows properly, you won't be able to access the drive on Linux without doing some magic. That's about it.
what CPU/processor does it have?
is Core 2 Duo enough?
Yeah. All Intel Core 2 processors can run either 32-bit or 64-bit; your choice.
which do you recommend me?
1) How much memory/RAM does the computer have? 2) Do you use it for specialized stuff like scientific computation, high-end video editing, etc?
it has 4gb ram, and the toughest things I use are 3D games.
is 64-bit faster?
You probably won't notice much difference. The only thing is that most 32-bit Operating Systems (including Ubuntu by default) can't address more than 3.something GB of memory.
how much ram can 64bit systems address?
way, way more than you'll ever have.
lol.. that sounds pretty evil
it's several thousand GB, I think
Flash, Java, Wine, and everything else work fine for me on 64-bit Ubuntu. Some people have problems with them though.
which is your processor?
Intel Core 2 Quad Q6600
that sounds like some sort of satanic apocalyptic thing
how many ghz?
2.4Hz per core
